Name: Geothermal Resource

Tool Tip.String: The angle at which a fracture propagates within a subsurface rock formation.

Tips.String: The angle at which a fracture propagates within a subsurface rock formation.

Tool Tip.String: The degree of openness between the blocks on either side of the fracture. Fracture aperture is typically up to a few millimeters in width.

Tips.String: The degree of openness between the blocks on either side of the fracture. Fracture aperture is typically up to a few millimeters in width.

Tool Tip.String: The distance between the injector and producer in a flow connected system, assuming the facture propagates optimally. It is also known as the fracture half length.

Tips.String: The distance between the injector and producer in a flow connected system, assuming the facture propagates optimally. It is also known as the fracture half length.

Tool Tip.String: The distance between two parallel fractures along a line perpendicular to the average orientation of the fracture set. Typical fracture spacing is in the range of centimeter to meter.

Tips.String: The distance between two parallel fractures along a line perpendicular to the average orientation of the fracture set. Typical fracture spacing is in the range of centimeter to meter.

Tool Tip.String: Fracture width refers to the opening width of a fracture along the normal direction.

Tips.String: Fracture width refers to the opening width of a fracture along the normal direction.

Tool Tip.String: Pressure drawdown is the difference between the reservoir pressure and the flowing wellbore pressure, which drives fluids from the reservoir into the wellbore.

Tips.String: Pressure drawdown is the difference between the reservoir pressure and the flowing wellbore pressure, which drives fluids from the reservoir into the wellbore.

Items.StringList: Enter change in pressure across the reservoir in units of psi-h per 1000 lb|Calculate reservoir pressure change using simple fracture flow (EGS only)|Calculate reservoir pressure change using permeability * area|User-entered reservoir model

Tool Tip.String: The depth below ground at which the temperature specified by the resource temperature exists.

Tips.String: The depth below ground at which the temperature specified by the resource temperature exists.

Tool Tip.String: An estimate of the total amount of energy available in the underground thermal reservoir. This determines how many times the plant can be renewed.

Tips.String: An estimate of the total amount of energy available in the underground thermal reservoir. This determines how many times the plant can be renewed.

Tool Tip.String: The temperature of the reservoir at the depth given by the resource depth.

Tips.String: The temperature of the reservoir at the depth given by the resource depth.

Tool Tip.String: The percentage of unintended escape of water from geothermal reservoirs or wells during the exploration, drilling, production.

Tips.String: The percentage of unintended escape of water from geothermal reservoirs or wells during the exploration, drilling, production.
